posts.title: Ignition-Powered Unified Namespace bij BMT Aerospace | AT-Automation Case Study
posts.content: AT-Automation ontwikkelde een Ignition-powered Unified Namespace (UNS) voor BMT Aerospace, waarmee alle shopfloor-data wordt gecentraliseerd en direct beschikbaar is voor MES, engineers en management. Dit project is geselecteerd als een van de Discover Gallery Projects van Ignition Community Conference 2025, een showcase van de meest innovatieve en impactvolle real-world Ignition-oplossingen wereldwijd. Wat je in deze video ziet: Hoe Ignition en Beckhoff IPCs meer dan 100 PLC‚Äôs en 70+ machine/CNC-merken integreren Real-time dashboards en visualisatie via Axiom Effici√´ntieverbeteringen: een boorproces werd 25% sneller door datagedreven inzichten Stappen richting Industry 4.0: digitalisering, connectiviteit, digitale tweeling, voorspelbaarheid en adaptieve productie Projectdetails: Start: december 2023 | Live: januari 2025 Team: BMT Aerospace, AT-Automation 16.000+ tags, 50+ schermen, 25+ clients, 20+ Beckhoff IPCs Multi-site integratie met Ignition, Canary, Azure Data Lake, SA
posts.author: AT-Automation

posts.title: Building a Unified Namespace with Tatsoft FrameworX
posts.content: ProveIt! 2025 Solution Overview: How FrameworX Outperforms Other IIoT Platforms in Speed, Flexibility and Cost ProveIt! 2025 is the premier Industry 4.0 Community Conference, designed to bridge the gap between theory and practice by showcasing real-world applications. At this event, Tatsoft was tasked with a difficult challenge: take messy, unstructured industrial data and turn it into a unified, contextualized model. We built the solution using FrameworX, an IIoT platform designed to support a Unified Namespace (UNS)‚Äîand we did it in under 2 weeks.
posts.author: TATSOFT

posts.title: Webinar: Designing an Information Model for Your UNS
posts.content: This webinar provides practical guidance on designing a robust information model for your Unified Namespace (UNS) that serves as a single source of truth and scales with your digital manufacturing strategy. We examine the shift from dynamically created namespaces to a centrally governed information model ‚Äî a structured approach that ensures consistency, interoperability, and readiness for advanced analytics and AI. The session will walk through key steps for building your information model, including: - Mapping the physical and logical structure of your organization - Modeling data flows between business systems and control systems - Contextualizing equipment resources and operational data within the UNS information model - Creating an edge-to-cloud UNS backbone to integrate shop floor data with advanced analytics and AI systems By the end of the session, you‚Äôll understand how to move beyond dynamic namespaces and establish a scalable, governable information model that becomes th
posts.author: HiveMQ

posts.title: What Is The Best Way To Integrate IIoT Data For A Unified View? - Industrial Tech Insights
posts.content: What Is The Best Way To Integrate IIoT Data For A Unified View? Are you curious about how industrial facilities connect and manage vast amounts of data from different machines and systems? In this video, we explore the most effective way to bring together Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) data into a single, comprehensive view. We‚Äôll cover how a well-structured approach can help unify data from diverse sources, including legacy equipment and modern digital systems, into a central platform. You‚Äôll learn about the role of a Unified Namespace supported by an industrial IoT platform, which acts as a central hub for collecting, normalizing, and sharing real-time data across the entire factory environment. We‚Äôll explain how this setup enables seamless communication between operational technology and enterprise systems, making data more accessible and trustworthy. Additionally, we‚Äôll discuss how transforming raw data into organized data products enhances analytics, decision-making, and aut
posts.author: Industrial Tech Insights

posts.title: How to Connect SparkplugB Devices to UMH Core in Minutes | Product Feature
posts.content: Learn how to bring SparkplugB data into the Unified Namespace with UMH Core. In this step-by-step demo, we show you how to: - Connect Ignition with SparkplugB - Create a read bridge in UMH Core - Stream and monitor data in real time - Extend data flows to databases, MQTT brokers, and more üëâ Whether you're an experienced integrator or just starting with UNS, UMH Core makes it simple to bring Sparkplug B data into your architecture. posts.author: Confluence Num√©rique

posts.title: Rethinking SCADA: Architecture for DevOps, UNS & Industry 4.0
posts.content: Is your Ignition SCADA architecture truly ready for a modern DevOps lifecycle? In this deep dive, we unveil a powerful, scalable architecture that leverages the latest features in Ignition 8.3 to solve common challenges in industrial automation. Discover the core concept of the "Ignition Tag Gateway," a dedicated hub for all tag providers and historian services. We explain how this model creates a true separation of concerns, decoupling your tags and production data from your application and visualization layers. Learn how you can finally achieve fearless DevOps, deploying updates and restoring gateways without ever risking the loss of tag state. We'll walk through the entire data flow, from edge controllers to a centralized Unified Namespace (UNS) published via MQTT. See how tools like Flow Software and Timebase Historian integrate seamlessly for advanced analytics and data management, and how this architecture provides a clean, single point for data modeling before it reaches enter
posts.author: Abelara Ascent

posts.title: How to connect MQTT through a data diode
posts.content: An MQTT client cannot connect through a data diode because MQTT requires two-way data flow just to send data. Before MQTT data can traverse a data diode, it must be received by a broker and converted to a unidirectional protocol. Outside the diode, the data then gets converted back to MQTT and sent by a second broker to subscribing clients. The MQTT data source connects to a DataHub Smart MQTT Broker, which uses the Tunnel/Mirror feature to pass the data through the diode. A second DataHub Smart MQTT Broker outside the data diode receives the data and makes it available for the MQTT client. Skkynet provides Cogent DataHub secure-by-design software and services to let you acquire, aggregate, monitor, control visualize, and network live process data in-plant or over insecure external networks, making it ideal for OT to IT and cloud connections. You can isolate control networks from cyber attacks and integrate industrial data under a unified namespace, all without compromising the p
posts.author: Skkynet

posts.title: CMMS Asset Hierarchy Explained: Functional Locations vs. Assets vs. Items
posts.content: Unlock the full potential of your asset reliability program by mastering the CMMS asset hierarchy. If you've ever struggled to get meaningful data from your maintenance system, an improper configuration is likely the culprit. In this deep dive, we break down the three core entities you MUST understand to build a fruitful and effective asset hierarchy: Functional Locations, Asset Records, and Item Records. Learn how each layer serves a distinct purpose, from high-level process identification down to individual procurable parts. We'll show you how to structure this information correctly so you can finally analyze where your maintenance dollars and hours are truly going. We also bridge the gap between traditional reliability terminology and the Industry 4.0 world, explaining how the CMMS asset hierarchy relates to concepts like the Unified Namespace (UNS) and semantic hierarchies. IN THIS VIDEO, YOU WILL LEARN: ‚Ä¢ The two primary goals of a well-configured CMMS. ‚Ä¢ The 3 core entities of
posts.author: Abelara Ascent

posts.title: How to connect MQTT through a data diode to a cloud broker
posts.content: An MQTT client cannot connect through a data diode because MQTT requires two-way data flow just to send data. Before MQTT data can traverse a data diode, it must be received by a broker and converted to a unidirectional protocol. Outside the diode, the data then gets converted back to MQTT. A typical scenario for MQTT is to connect a device to a cloud server. If that device is behind a data diode, it can be connected to a DataHub Smart MQTT Broker, which uses the Tunnel/Mirror feature to pass the data through the diode. At that point a second DataHub instance receives the data, and acting as an MQTT client, sends the data to an MQTT broker running on the cloud. Skkynet provides Cogent DataHub secure-by-design software and services to let you acquire, aggregate, monitor, control visualize, and network live process data in-plant or over insecure external networks, making it ideal for OT to IT and cloud connections. You can isolate control networks from cyber attacks and integrate ind
posts.author: Skkynet

posts.title: UNS Executive Summary
posts.content: Kevin Jones explains that many manufacturers struggle with growth because they rely on fragmented systems, paper processes, and ERP-centered operations that create data silos and technical debt. He outlines how a Unified Namespace (UNS) approach - built on standards, incremental problem-solving, and strong change management - can break through these limitations, provide real-time visibility, and enable scalable digital transformation. The process involves assessing digital maturity, building a standards-based foundation, connecting data silos, and progressing toward MES, analytics, and eventually AI/ML.
posts.author: Ectobox, Inc.

posts.title: AI Turns Bad Data to Sparkle Will It Be Good Enough? #ai #unifiednamespace
posts.content: Alejandro Sim√≥ Vesperinas, IT/OT Architect at Mayker, presents real world architectures at CONNACK! in Munich. He humorously discusses how AI and generative AI can improve bad data, acknowledging their potential while noting they still have underlying issues. He goes on to humorously talk about LLMs or Agentic AI, pointing out that while it can make things look good, sometimes it still might not be good enough. Watch the full presentation "Deploying Real World UNS Architectures with MQTT and Node RED - Mayker": https://youtu.be/KHUB5MwxlAo Visit hivemq.com to find out more about Smart Manufacturing and Industrial Digitalization: https://bit.ly/46womu1 #unifiednamespace #nodered #smartmanufacturing
posts.author: HiveMQ

posts.title: CTERA Enterprise Intelligence: Unify & Activate Your Private Data for Faster & Smarter Outcomes
posts.content: This session offers insight into the seamless integration of AI within the CTERA Intelligent Data Platform. Embedded AI and analytic Enterprise Data Services are explored, along with the underlying data fabric that facilitates secure, global data connectivity and ensures high-performance access. Additionally, the session demonstrates how agentic AI advances productivity, enabling virtual employees to interact efficiently with private data resources while maintaining robust security and operational effectiveness. CTERA's approach to enterprise intelligence is structured around three key pillars. The first pillar focuses on embedding AI and analytics within data management for enhanced security and data quality. This includes real-time inspection of I/O for anomaly detection and integration with security solutions like Purview. The second pillar involves providing a data foundation and fabric for AI training and inferencing, offering a global namespace for data aggregation and access, a
posts.author: Tech Field Day

posts.title: What is AI Ready Storage, with Hammerspace
posts.content: AI Ready Storage is data infrastructure designed to break down silos and give enterprises seamless, high-performance access to their data wherever it lives. With 73% of enterprise data trapped in silos and 87% of AI projects failing to reach production, the bottleneck isn‚Äôt GPUs‚Äîit‚Äôs data. Traditional environments suffer from visualization challenges, high costs, and data gravity that limits AI flexibility. Hammerspace simplifies the enterprise data estate by unifying silos into a single global namespace and providing instant access to data‚Äîwithout forklift upgrades‚Äîso organizations can accelerate AI success. The presentation focused on leveraging existing infrastructure and data to make it AI-ready, emphasizing simplicity for AI researchers under pressure to deliver high-quality results quickly. Hammerspace simplifies the data readiness process, enabling easy access and utilization of data within infrastructure projects. While the presentation covers technical aspects, the emphasis r
posts.author: Tech Field Day

posts.title: UNS Architecture Solves IT OT Data Challenges Security & Scalability #nodered #ai
posts.content: Alejandro Sim√≥ Vesperinas, IT/OT Architect at Mayker, provides an overview of the presentation on UNS architectures, focusing on key areas like data quality, security, and scalability, followed by a discussion on data processing in manufacturing and its importance. He introduces the presentation by discussing adding context, maintaining data quality, security, reducing attacks, and scalability within UNS architectures. Alejandro explains that in manufacturing, 'garbage in, garbage out' applies to data, and emphasizes the importance of processing data before sending it to a broker, highlighting the need for solutions beyond just sending raw data. Watch the full presentation "Deploying Real World UNS Architectures with MQTT and Node RED - Mayker": https://youtu.be/KHUB5MwxlAo Visit hivemq.com to find out more about Smart Manufacturing and Industrial Digitalization: https://bit.ly/46womu1 #unifiednamespace #nodered #smartmanufacturing #datamodeling

In this session, Dan Duperron reveals how Hammerspace delivers an open, standards-based data platform that unifies file and object access across edge, data centers, and cloud, eliminating vendor lock-in and enabling linear scalability using an existing infrastructure. This session covers: ‚Ä¢ Parallel Global File Systems with pNFS 4.2: Harness open standards for high-performance, distributed data access without proprietary clients. ‚Ä¢ Automated Data Orchestration: Enable real-time, seamless data movement across storage types while ensuring continuous availability. ‚Ä¢ Optimized Workflows for AI & HPC: Leverage a unified namespace to simplify workflows, accelerate insig
posts.author: A3 Communications

posts.title: How to connect OPC DA through a data diode
posts.content: An OPC DA client cannot connect to an OPC DA server through a data diode because all incoming data gets blocked. To solve this problem, the DataHub tunnel/mirror approach encapsulates OPC DA within a unidirectional transport layer that can pass through the diode. On the receiving side, a DataHub instance converts the data back into OPC DA data for the client application. A further benefit of this approach is that it eliminates the hassles of configuring DCOM, and any issues with the KB5004442 security patch from Microsoft. Skkynet provides Cogent DataHub secure-by-design software and services to let you acquire, aggregate, monitor, control visualize, and network live process data in-plant or over insecure external networks, making it ideal for OT to IT and cloud connections. You can isolate control networks from cyber attacks and integrate industrial data under a unified namespace, all without compromising the plant. https://cogentdatahub.com/how-to-connect-opc-da-through-a-data-d
posts.author: Skkynet

posts.title: Digitalization in Manufacturing Cloetta casestudy powered by AT-Automation
posts.content: In deze klantcase video toont AT-Automation hoe Cloetta, een toonaangevend snoepgoedbedrijf in Noord-Europa, hun productieprocessen heeft gedigitaliseerd met behulp van Ignition en Sepasoft MES. Door verouderde systemen te moderniseren en data centraal te verzamelen via een Unified Namespace (UNS), heeft Cloetta realtime inzicht gekregen in hun productie. De implementatie op een Linux-omgeving met Docker-containers zorgt voor snelle uitrol, flexibiliteit en schaalbaarheid. Ontdek hoe deze digitale transformatie bijdraagt aan effici√´nter gebruik van middelen en een proactieve, datagestuurde benadering van productie. #Digitalisering #Industry40 #Manufacturing #Ignition #MES #Cloetta #Automation #DataDriven #ATAutomation

posts.title: How to connect OPC UA through a data diode
posts.content: An OPC UA client cannot connect to an OPC UA server through a data diode because all incoming data gets blocked. OPC UA pub/sub can make outbound connections, but it relies on UDP, which is not practical for most industrial applications. Data delivered over UDP can be damaged, out of sequence, or incomplete. To solve this problem, the DataHub tunnel/mirror approach encapsulates OPC UA within a unidirectional transport layer that can pass through the diode. On the receiving side, a DataHub instance converts the data back into OPC UA data for the client application. Skkynet provides Cogent DataHub secure-by-design software and services to let you acquire, aggregate, monitor, control visualize, and network live process data in-plant or over insecure external networks, making it ideal for OT to IT and cloud connections. You can isolate control networks from cyber attacks and integrate industrial data under a unified namespace, all without compromising the plant. https://cogentdatahub.

posts.title: How Can IIoT Data Acquisition Overcome Protocol Challenges? - Industrial Tech Insights
posts.content: How Can IIoT Data Acquisition Overcome Protocol Challenges? Have you ever wondered how factories connect diverse machines and systems to operate smoothly? In this informative video, we'll explain how data acquisition in industrial environments overcomes protocol challenges. We'll start by discussing the common issues faced when integrating old and new equipment with different communication protocols. You'll learn how protocol translation gateways act as interpreters, enabling seamless data sharing across various systems without costly replacements. We'll also explore the role of edge computing in processing data locally, reducing delays, and improving real-time decision making. Additionally, we'll cover the importance of establishing a solid data strategy, including setting standards for data quality, identifying bottlenecks, and planning for future growth. Security measures like encryption and network segmentation are vital to protect sensitive information as more devices connect to t
posts.author: Industrial Tech Insights

posts.title: Activating Tier 0 Storage Within GPU and CPU-based Compute Cluster with Hammerspace
posts.content: The highest performing storage available today is an untapped resource within your server clusters that can be activated by Hammerspace to accelerate AI workloads and increase GPU utilization. This session covers how Hammerspace unifies local NVMe across server clusters as a protected, ultra-fast tier that is part of a unified global namespace. This underutilized capacity can now accelerate AI workloads as shared storage, with data automatically orchestrated by Hammerspace across other tiers and cloud storage to increase time to token while also reducing infrastructure costs. Floyd Christopherson from Hammerspace introduces Tier 0, focusing on how it accelerates AI workflows in GPU and CPU-based clusters. The core problem addressed is the stranded capacity of local NVMe storage within servers, which, despite its speed, is often underutilized. Accessing data over the network to external storage becomes a bottleneck, especially in AI workflows with growing context lengths and fast token
posts.author: Tech Field Day
